Read all files in specified directory into one single stream object.

instrument_caracterization(poles, zeros, gain, sensitivity)[source]¶
kutec_read(fname)[source]¶

Read the K-UTec proprietary file format.

Read data in the K-UTec specific IMC FAMOS format into a stream object. As there is no obvious station information in the data file Network is set to KU and Station is set to the first five letters of the filename.

Parameters:
fname : string
path to the file containing the data to be read

Returns

st : obspy.core.Stream object
Obspy stream object containing the data
stream_arklink_read(host='webdc.eu', port=18001, timeout=100, start_time='2009-08-24 00:20:03', time_interval=30, network_id='BW', station_id='RJOB', location_id='', channel_id='EH*', get_paz=False)[source]¶

Arklink server client.

For a detailed description of how it works refer to ObsPy website (obspy.org)

stream_collapse_tr(st)[source]¶
stream_collapse_tr_new(st, npts, onacopy=True)[source]¶

Collapse all the traces with the same id averaging their points value.

This function collapse (adds) all the traces in one Stream that shares the same id to a single one with averaged data vector and the same meta-information (i.e. tr.stats object). All the traces are padded/shriked to npts points before averaging. This function works by default on a copy of the original Stream so that it is not affected by the function execution. To override the original one put the flag onacopy to False

Parameters:
  • st (Stream) – Stream that contains the traces that will be collapsed
  • npts (Int) – Number of points in the resulting traces
  • onacopy (Bool) – Work on a copy of the original stream if True
Return type:

Stream
Returns:

st_collapsed: Stream with one trace for each unique tr.id.

Read SEG2 data recorded with the DMT summit aquisition unit.

Read the SEG2 formatted seismic data aquired with the summit recorder and fill the ID fields in the stats.

usarray_read(fname)[source]¶

Read the BAM US-Array lbv data format used on Mike-2 test specimen.

Read the BAM US-Array lbv data format used on Mike-2 test specimen into a stream object. As there is no obvious station (or any other) information in the data file. As the parameters are not supposed to change, they are hardcoded here.

Parameters:
Parameters:fname (string) – Path to the file containing the data to be read (WITHOUT EXTENSION) extensions .dat and .hdr will be added automatically
Return type:Stream object
Returns:st: obspy.core.Stream object Obspy stream object containing the data
